2.title: How to Sand Wood Sexy
2.plot: This episode is part one of a three part series on rehabilitating a worn out wood shelf. In part one Aniela shows you have to use an electric sander.

3.title: How to Stain Wood
3.plot: Part 2 of 3 in the rehabilitation of the wooden shelf. In this episode Aniela slathers on the stain.

4.title: How to Polyurethane
4.plot: Part 3 of 3 in the rehabilitation of the wooden shelf. In this episode Aniela gets sticky.

5.title: How to Burn Your Tree
5.plot: If you have ever kept your Christmas tree up for too long, this is the episode for you. Aniela has fun setting her tree ablaze.

6.title: How to Trim Your Bush
6.plot: What everyone needs to learn...how to trim your BUSH safely.

7.title: Worms
7.plot: In this episode, Aniela teaches you how to start a worm farm in a prefabricated worm house.

8.title: How to Make a Garden BED
8.plot: Aniela get dirty while she shows you how to make a new garden bed.

9.title: How to Sew on a Button
9.plot: Episode 1.9 is all about how to push a woman's buttons or more accurately how to sew on your own. Aniela shares a few easy and extremely helpful tips on how to sew on a button.

10.title: How to Replace Outside Car Door Handle: Toyota
10.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: "How to DO it" is a corky How-to web series created by the actress Aniela McGuinness featuring different manly tasks performed with a sexy, comical, female flare. Aniela McGuinness trained at Florida State University as a theater technician. After graduation she became the carpentry and electric assistant at the James L. Knight Center and then moved over to props at the Florida Grand Opera. When she became a full-time actress she still wanted a place to showcase all of the random manly skills she acquired and to teach women and men carpentry, gardening, and simple car repairs can really be easy.
